color.title: A Color Definition
color.description: Describes a Dynamic Color, which APIs can tweak to get an accurately themed color.

color.title: Base Color
color.description: HEX or CSS color for this color entry.

saturationMultiplier.title: Saturation Multiplier
saturationMultiplier.description: Limit how much the saturation slider can affect the color. 1=Full, 0=Static Color. White, Black, and Grey are forced at 0 saturation.

lightnessMultiplier.title: Lightness Multiplier
lightnessMultiplier.description: Limit how much the lightness slider can affect the color. 1=Full, 0=Static Color. White and Black are forced at 0 lightness, since they represent ends of the grey spectrum.

type.description: Type of Elemental Data. For Elemental 4 themes it must be 'elemental4:theme'

version.title: Theme Version
version.description: User set value. Used for updating.

name.title: Theme Display Name
name.description: Displayed in the theme menu, in bold.

description.title: Theme Description
description.description: Displayed in the theme menu, under the theme name in smaller font.

icon.title: Theme Icon Path
icon.description: Icon to be displayed next to the theme, should be 128x128. URL is resolved from this file, so it can be relative.

styles.title: Theme CSS Styles
styles.description: Theme CSS Files. URL is resolved from this file, so it can be relative.

sound_merge_mode.title: Sound Merge Mode
sound_merge_mode.description: Decides how sound entries from other themes should mix with this one. Combine means it will combine themes with sounds before it, Override means it will override packs before it.

music_merge_mode.title: Music Merge Mode
music_merge_mode.description: Decides how music entries from other themes should mix with this one. Combine means it will combine themes with music before it, Override means it will override themes before it.

colors.title: Color Definitions
colors.description: Decides how music entries from other themes should mix with this one. Combine means it will combine themes with music before it, Override means it will override themes before it.
